title: How to Write on Pictures in Word

steps.title: Open your project in Word.
steps.content: Open your project in Word. You can do this by clicking Open from the File tab, or by right-clicking the file icon in your file browser and choosing Word from the "Open with…" dialog.

steps.title: Click the Insert tab.
steps.content: Click the Insert tab. You'll find this above the document in the menu toolbar or along the top of your screen.

steps.title: Click Text Box.
steps.content: Click Text Box . You'll find this option in the Text group. A menu will dropdown. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Draw Text Box.
steps.content: Click Draw Text Box . You'll see this at the bottom of the menu that drops down.

steps.title: Enter your text.
steps.content: Enter your text. You'll see your text entered into a moveable object. You can highlight your text and change the font size, color, and style before continuing.

steps.title: Drag and drop your text box over the picture.
steps.content: Drag and drop your text box over the picture. Don't deselect the text box yet.

steps.title: Click the Format tab.
steps.content: Click the Format tab. You'll find this above the document in the menu toolbar or along the top of your screen.

steps.title: Format your text box in "Shape Styles."
steps.content: Format your text box in "Shape Styles." You'll want to make sure your text is not hidden by other elements. Click Shape Fill and select No fill . Click Shape Outline and select No outline .

steps.title: Group the picture and text box.
steps.content: Group the picture and text box. You can do this by clicking the picture to select it, then pressing and holding Ctrl (PC) or ⌘ Cmd (Mac) and clicking the text box to select it as well. Under the Format tab, click Group . [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Open your project in Word.
steps.content: Open your project in Word. This app icon looks like a blue page with white writing on it, and you can find this app on your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. To open your project in Word, you'll need to tap Open from the File tab. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Tap the pencil icon (optional).
steps.content: Tap the pencil icon (optional). If you don't see the pencil icon above the document, you may already be in editing mode.

steps.title: Tap the upwards-pointing arrow .
steps.content: Tap the upwards-pointing arrow . You'll see this on the right of the options menu.

steps.title: Tap Home.
steps.content: Tap Home . You'll open up a list of toolbar options.

steps.title: Tap Insert.
steps.content: Tap Insert . You'll see the Insert menu options.

steps.title: Tap Text Box.
steps.content: Tap Text Box . You might have to scroll down to see this option. After you tap this, you'll see a text box with dummy text inserted on your page.

steps.title: Format your text box.
steps.content: Format your text box. After you've inserted your text box, you'll notice the main menu shifts to Shape . You'll want to edit this text box from this menu. From Fill , choose ' No fill . From Outline , choose No outline .

steps.title: Tap inside the text box.
steps.content: Tap inside the text box. A menu will pop up.

steps.title: Tap Edit Text.
steps.content: Tap Edit Text . Your cursor will appear in the text box. You'll first need to delete what's already in the text box. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Tap the checkmark when you're done to save your work.
steps.content: Tap the checkmark when you're done to save your work. You'll see this in the upper left corner of the app.
